primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God creates a 'New Creation' by justifying the ungodly, thereby leveling all human distinctions and prideful hierarchies.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically through the Cross of Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: only God who gives the growth
the grace and love of God freely given to us in the Cross

object.identificatie: The New Creation / Justification of the Ungodly
tekstueel_bewijs: neither is circumcision anything... but a new creation
What do you have that you did not receive [as a gift] from God?

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Miserable Offender' / The Ungodly / The Hearer
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly invited to identify as the Receiver (the 'miserable offender').

helper.identificatie: The Apostle Paul (as witness) and Jesus Christ (as Mediator)
tekstueel_bewijs: the Cross of the One of whom it is written
I summon as my witness... F.F. Bruce
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject; Christ is the means of the Subject's action.

tegenstander.identificatie: Human Pride / The Law (as the power of Sin) / Distinctions
tekstueel_bewijs: the power of Sin is the Law
we perpetually make distinctions among ourselves in order to judge ourselves
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but the 'form of this world' and the 'power of Sin' which uses even the Law to kill.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's response to grace (quitting smoking, keeping commandments) as a non-meritorious fruit.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is explicitly decoupled from the primary's efficacy ('Smoking is nothing...'). It is a consequence, not a condition.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God's grace to me... came in the person of...
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The Corinthians were the Olympic athletes

voorbeelden: what matters is keeping the commandments
I love to get good seats
Paul was an eminently contextual theologian
I don’t need to rely on these cigarettes anymore

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the human lack of power (inability to stand) and the divine endowment of power (New Creation).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from ~S1 (Pride in quitting smoking) to S2 (Who can stand?) to S1 (Justification of the ungodly), while warning against ~S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The Cross 'rents the curtain,' collapsing the distinctions of ~S1 and ~S2 into the S1 reality.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the quote from Psalm 130:3 establishes that without grace, no one stands.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently identifies God as the actor in salvation and reduces human 'doing' to 'nothing' in the face of the New Creation.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the smoking story
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I have never smoked a cigarette since.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: What do you have that you did not receive [as a gift] from God?

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Paul, Apollos) are explicitly described as 'nothing' to prevent exemplarism.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: 'Only God who gives the growth.'

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon masterfully integrates the 'Law' and 'Gospel' contexts of Corinth and Galatia into a single narrative of Grace.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'keeping commandments' and 'circumcision is nothing'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the justification of the ungodly... freely given to us in the Cross

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'fruits' which are not Law.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as an 'addiction' and 'vanity' that requires a 'miserable offender' status.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by God's action. Human effort is relegated to the 'nothing' category regarding status.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The use of the 1928 Prayer Book language reinforces the 'Pouvoir' lack in humans.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A textbook example of a grace-oriented sermon that uses structural 'nothingness' to exalt the 'everything' of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the smoking anecdote's humor; semiotics reveals it as a 'Subject-failure' narrative that points to God's agency.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'kaine ktisis'; semiotics shows how 'New Creation' functions as the Object that replaces 'Circumcision'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'inclusiveness' mentioned is not a human social program (Subject=Man) but a semiotic leveling caused by the Cross (Subject=God).

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Helper' trap where God merely assists human improvement.
